reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel was in a pinch. Intended to stay in Cork, but GPS went haywire and directions and signage was impossible to find a place to stay so I moved on down the road to Kinsale and the White House was the spot!
reviews.title: Quaint little hotel in a quaint little seaside village
Decent spot
reviews.text: Room was decent....nothing fancy. Shower was crazy tiny and pressure was a bit slow. Place was quiet and village was empty due to being a weekday in November. Most stores were closed too. Parking for free on street until 10:30am or free lot behind the hotel. It's a midrange hotel and a bit pricey for what I thought the area and the season was...but compatible to other hotels in town.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room came with breakfast. Breakfast was typical Ireland, eggs, sausage, bacon, and black/white pudding. Again nothing fancy but well appreciated.
reviews.title: Great place for breakfast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel~Everything we were looking for and more

reviews.text: Stayed here 1 night. Rooms were nice and very clean without being amazing. Carpets were nice but the room was a little small. The shower was tiny. Breakfast was excellent. Great location within walking distance of all the pubs & restaurants. I would stay again.
reviews.title: Thank You, White House!

reviews.text: Four of us travelled up on the ferry from Juneau and found The White House a very comfortable place to stay for two nights. The walk up from the harbor took about 20 minutes and we were pleased to be off the main street in a quiet area. We were grateful for Jan's recommendations of things to see and do locally. The weather was warm and sunny during our stay and we took advantage of a couple of hiking trails, as well as taking the train trip up to White Pass - an awe-inspiring journey. We appreciated the breakfast that Jan provided and like most others, especially enjoyed her homemade muffins and cookies. I would highly recommend The White House and we also liked the Stowaway Cafe for lunch and dinner.
reviews.title: A great B&B in Skagway
A gem of place to stay in Skagway
reviews.text: This is an elegant, comfortable restored home -- very quiet, good beds, friendly innkeepers and staff. It was easily walkable to most anywhere in town. It seemed as though something was always baking in the kitchen, and the cookies and muffins were scrumptious! I recommend the White House very highly and hope to return there sometime soon.

Great place to stay. Clean and comfortable and close to downtown. It would have been nice to have more of a breakfast than muffins, but we knew this up front. Loved the bacon cheese muffins, though. This was our favorite place during our trip to Alaska.
reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you're looking for a homey, comfortable place to stay in Skagway that's only two blocks from the crowded main street (Broadway), here's where you want to stay. Our room was quiet and comfortable, we had good advice about where to eat and what to see, the afternoon cookies were a plus, the muffins at breakfast yummy. And it's walking distance from everything we wanted to do.
reviews.title: Oh, Those Muffins!
Great house -White House
reviews.text: We stayed here for two night. We love it. Jan and John were excellent hosts. Their homemade muffins were great, the sheets were crisp and the pillows were cold. Highly reccomended. Located just two blocks from from the hustle and bustle of Broadway(skagway, Ak) Christy,Richard, of Slidell,La and Maria, Olympia ,WA

We were a party of 5 who spent one night at the White House in early August. We had two rooms and we were all happy with the quality and cleanliness of the rooms. The muffins and cookies were a pleasant surprise on our arrival. Breakfast was satisfying. We loved the decor especially the quilts!
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here by accidentally finding it. It was so friendly, so very clean, and so very comfortable. It's also walking distance to town so the convenience is there. The breakfast was well rounded, healthy and plentiful. I'd stay here again for sure if I ever get the pleasure of visiting Skaway again!
reviews.title: You will love this place

reviews.text: Skagway is like a little switzerland in alaska; except with giant cruise ships looming over the small town. The white house, while pleasant, was expensive for the quality. The hotel, in a refurbished old house, is downtown, but not on the main street, and quite quiet at night. The lobby is attractive, and quaint; the rooms are less so, and while very clean, are stuffy and hot; the fan could not cool our rooms off. Bathrooms had a noisy fan, and were very simple. Breakfast was very simple; the kind of cereal and toast your own toast kind, with hardboiled eggs in the fridge you could microwave if you wanted; for the price, i did expect more. The people who run it are nice, and sort of off in their world;
reviews.title: Just average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived by ferry for a one nighter. Check in was very simple with our reservations already in place. Our room was ready on our arrival and the staff was very friendly and inviting. The room was basic, but comfortable. My only complaint was the bed, which was one of the old spring type. Breakfast was a simple continental type. On our departure, the ferry was to be leaving much later than check out. The staff/owner accomodated us by letting us store our luggage in a room downstairs until our departure. The history of the building is very interesting as is the history of the whole area.
reviews.title: Very quaint, lovely!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at The White House was everything we needed it to be - comfortable, convenient and with good breakfasts. The owners were friendly, helpful and professional, everything ran very smoothly. We were even able to to some laundry without any hassle.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is perfect, within walking distance of anything in Skagway. The breakfast is continental and has everything a person would need. Our room was clean and bright. Jan, the hostess, shared valuable advice for our stay. We would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Our Best B and B

reviews.text: Great location, but be aware that the 2nd floor (where the rooms are) was rebuilt with so little sound-proofing that one can hear the neighboring guest brushing their teeth - and everything else they do in the bathroom.
reviews.title: Generally nice

reviews.text: There were four of us in two rooms, and we each thoroughly enjoyed staying at The White House. The rooms and inn are very clean and filled with history. The beds are very comfortable, and the inn is quiet. The decor is lovingly period-appropriate. The innkeepers are pleasant and helpful. Breakfast is continental, with homemade muffins, etc. We would not hesitate to stay here again, and highly recommend The White House.
reviews.title: What a great place to stay~

reviews.text: My husband and I booked our mini vacation to Skagway and we searched trip advisor to find accommodations - lets just say that the reviews led us to the most outstanding place to stay! The White House is beautiful inside and out - it is exceptionally clean and ever so charming. I hesitate to write this review because I fear everyone will stay here now and I won't be able to get a reservation at a late notice....it is the perfect Skagway Inn!
reviews.title: You have to stay here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was just perfect right from the start. This B&B is more like a small hotel from my point of view. The reception, hallway were very clean and nicely decorated. The room was very nice and clean, of course, with comfy bed and cable TV. The hotel is situated on a quiet street, away from Boardway hustle and bustle. Still, it´s only 5min walk to downtown. Delicious muffins are served at the breakfast.
reviews.title: Top notch
Great breakfasts
reviews.text: We stayed here during our 3 day visit to Skagway. This was a comfortable, quiet place to stay. We especially liked that it was within walking distance of the downtown area. The muffins for breakfast, especially the honey rhubarb, we're the best. The hosts were quite helpful in planning your activities and were obviously quite knowledgable of both Skagway and Southeast Alaska.

What a great choice! I was there for three nights and had to drag myself away. The rate was a bit more than I like to pay by myself, but well worth it. My room was large and comfortable, with a nice bathroom, small fridge and TV. I could imagine staying all winter and writing a great novel at the big polished wood desk. Breakfasts are self-service, but with an attentive host nearby, and there are homemade muffins, toast, cereals and toppings, yoghurts, boiled eggs, fresh fruit. There is a lounge area with TV adjacent, which became a home from home. A selection of teas and coffee were available all the time, with more homemade muffins and a cookie jar. John and Jan are friendly and professional at the same time, with good dining and sightseeing tips. John even gave me his bear spray when we bumped into each other in the woods. Don't be put off if there is no-one there to greet you when you arrive - they are close by and will come immediately when you use the desk phone. The outside of the house is pretty, with spacious lawns and flower beds, and the building is noted in the historic walking tour of Skagway. The public library with wireless access is next door.
reviews.title: Comfortable in every sense of the word

reviews.text: The best place to stay in Skagway. Our party of 6 visited for three nights and had three very nice rooms. The hosts were friendly and helpful, arranging shuttles and providing suggestions. Breakfasts were just right with good coffee, fresh muffins and other choices. Beautiful, well maintained building conveniently located in a quiet neighborhood a short walk from the center of town.
reviews.title: Skagway's best accomodations

reviews.text: What a great place to stay. Very cozy rooms. I stayed in the one with 2 twins beings I was by myself. Great price for Alaska.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in fun town

reviews.text: We were up for a family event and stayed a full week. This is a charming B&B. The owners Jan and John and the staff are friendly, helpful and fun. Breakfast is good and the muffins made daily. Do not miss the cookie jar!
reviews.title: We will stay again
